base_text:
Here's a revised version of your marketing copy, carefully edited to align with SEC RIA marketing rules while retaining your original intent and voice.

---

## Our History & Purpose

[REDACTED:ORG] is committed to providing comprehensive wealth management to individuals and families. Our purpose is to strive to make a meaningful difference in the lives of those we serve.

The firm was formed by the merger of two firms based in [REDACTED:ADDRESS]. [REDACTED:NAME] founded [REDACTED:ORG] in 2001. As he described it, "his life became much more interesting" in [REDACTED:DATE] when he suffered a terrible accident leaving him paralyzed. Despite this challenge, and through remarkable dedication and determination, [REDACTED:NAME] continued to provide a client-centered approach to wealth management for his clients.

[REDACTED:ORG] was founded by [REDACTED:NAME], CRPC & CMFC, in April of 2010. He chose to establish an independent firm, believing this structure would provide the most appropriate platform to offer services and options focused on clients’ needs.

In 2012, [REDACTED:NAME] joined [REDACTED:ORG] as a Tax Planning Consultant to add depth and experience for our clients. With nearly 30 years of accounting experience and having achieved the Certified Financial Planner™ designation, his perspective contributes significantly to the benefit of our clients.

In 2015, [REDACTED:NAME] was introduced to [REDACTED:ORG] and founder [REDACTED:NAME]. They recognized similar skill sets and a shared passion for serving investors, leading them to develop a strategic alliance to collaborate for the benefit of their clients.

Unfortunately, [REDACTED:NAME] passed away due to complications associated with his condition on July 1st, [REDACTED:DATE]. [REDACTED:NAME] is honored to continue the legacy of [REDACTED:NAME] by serving as a dedicated advisor for both the clients of [REDACTED:ORG] and [REDACTED:ORG]. [REDACTED:ORG] has since merged with [REDACTED:ORG], and going forward, we will operate solely as [REDACTED:ORG].

Today, [REDACTED:ORG] is dedicated to helping clients pursue their financial goals through The Wealth Empowerment Program.

---

## Our People

### OUR CONSULTANTS

**[REDACTED:NAME], CRPC®, CMFC®, AIF**
Financial Consultant

[REDACTED:NAME] has been enthusiastically committed to providing personalized wealth management solutions to his clients for nearly two decades. Throughout this time, he has had what he calls ‘a front row seat’ in observing client progress and the impact of tailored guidance based on a true understanding of each client’s unique needs. He believes the foundation of all financial planning and progress begins with having a comprehensive wealth management plan in place – one that addresses all aspects of planning and preparing for significant life events. This includes planning for retirement, navigating retirement, addressing unexpected illness or loss, funding children/grandchildren’s education, and much more.

Before beginning his career in the financial services field, [REDACTED:NAME] graduated with a Bachelor’s of Science in Finance from Auburn University. He immediately began working in the financial services industry in back-office services and product development. Soon after, his skills led him to an external sales role for several mutual fund, 401(k), and annuity carriers. [REDACTED:NAME] focused on providing financial advisors with retirement income options to offer their retail clients, aiming to provide financial clarity.

In [REDACTED:DATE], [REDACTED:NAME] founded [REDACTED:ORG] to pursue his passion for helping others plan for and work towards financial independence, and he continues to do so as the President of [REDACTED:ORG]. He holds the Certified Retirement Planning Counselor (CRPC) designation, the Chartered Mutual Fund Counselor (CMFC) designation through the College for Financial Planning, and is an Accredited Investment Fiduciary (AIF).

**More About [REDACTED:NAME]**
[REDACTED:NAME] is married to his wife of [REDACTED:DATE] years, [REDACTED:NAME], and they have two children. They make their home in [REDACTED:ADDRESS] where they are very active in their community, church, local business organizations, and schools. In [REDACTED:DATE], [REDACTED:NAME] completed the Leadership [REDACTED:ADDRESS] (LJC) program and was formerly on the board of both the LJC and the [REDACTED:ADDRESS] Business Association, serving as President of the [REDACTED:ADDRESS] Business Association in [REDACTED:DATE].

**[REDACTED:NAME], CPA, CFP®**
Tax & Financial Planning Professional

[REDACTED:NAME] provides professional Tax Preparation & Planning services to our clients, offering the advantage of integrated tax considerations within our financial planning. The complexity of tax matters and their effect on wealth can be significant, and we are pleased to provide our clients with a specialist like [REDACTED:NAME] to help them navigate this area.

[REDACTED:NAME] has more than 30 years of experience in financial services and is both a CPA (Certified Public Accountant) and a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNERTM practitioner. He previously managed a tax practice that served over 600 clients and was also the principal of the financial planning division. [REDACTED:NAME] offers tax preparation services and supports the investment and financial planning strategies we offer through [REDACTED:ORG].

[REDACTED:NAME] received his undergraduate degree in Accounting from the University of Georgia and his Master’s degree in Finance from Georgia State University. He is a member of the Financial Planning Association of Georgia and the Georgia Society of CPAs.

**More About [REDACTED:NAME]**
[REDACTED:NAME] makes his home here in [REDACTED:ADDRESS] and has lived in the area since [REDACTED:DATE]. He and his wife, [REDACTED:NAME], have two children and are very active in sports and their community. Being actively involved in his community, both personally and as a business partner, is very important to [REDACTED:NAME]. He has been in the [REDACTED:ADDRESS] Rotary since [REDACTED:DATE] and has served two terms as President. Additionally, [REDACTED:NAME] completed the Leadership [REDACTED:ADDRESS] program in [REDACTED:DATE] and has been active on the board of the Financial Planning Association of Georgia.

### OUR OPERATIONS & CLIENT SERVICE SPECIALISTS

**[REDACTED:NAME]**
Office Manager

[REDACTED:NAME] is dedicated to providing high-quality client service and manages all account administration and office operations. She will gladly assist you with booking appointments and is the first person you should contact with questions about the wealth management process. She will ensure that the appropriate member of our team responds to your query in a prompt, professional manner.

**More About [REDACTED:NAME]**
[REDACTED:NAME] is a graduate of the University of Georgia and has primarily worked in sales and marketing. She is a Georgia native who has lived in [REDACTED:ADDRESS] for the past [REDACTED:DATE] years with her husband, [REDACTED:NAME]. They have 2 daughters. She enjoys working with people and brings enthusiasm and commitment to her role as office manager in handling day-to-day office duties and client engagement.

**[REDACTED:NAME]**
Compliance Coordinator

[REDACTED:NAME] oversees and coordinates all aspects of compliance within our operations. Her meticulous attention to detail and thorough review of account administration, portfolio management, and all aspects of regulatory reporting help ensure our operations run efficiently and effectively – reflecting our commitment to professionalism and integrity in our client experience.

**More About [REDACTED:NAME]**
[REDACTED:NAME] is married to her husband of [REDACTED:DATE] years, [REDACTED:NAME], and they have two children. They make their home in [REDACTED:ADDRESS] where they are very active in their community, church, local business organizations, and schools. In her spare time, [REDACTED:NAME] enjoys cross-fit, gardening, cooking, and driving the children to and from sporting events. She has a Paralegal degree from Perimeter College and also attended Valdosta State University.

---

## Our Partnership with Others

Because your financial situation can be complex, we often work collaboratively with other professionals to design and implement strategies intended to help you achieve your goals. We may rely on a network of professionals who provide technical advice as required.

The professionals we may work with include, but are not limited to:
*   Estate Lawyer
*   Certified Public Accountant
*   Mortgage Broker
*   Real Estate (Commercial and residential)
*   General Insurance

We believe it is beneficial for all of your professionals to communicate and work together to help ensure your goals are being addressed in the most effective ways possible.

---

## Our Beliefs

We believe today, more than ever, individuals and families are seeking professional advice from an advisor who:
*   Works in partnership with them over the long-term to help them pursue what matters to them;
*   Is passionately committed to helping them simplify, organize, and coordinate all aspects of their wealth management;
*   Has a well-defined process to guide them through essential aspects of wealth management; and
*   Is dedicated to providing professional, caring, and personalized solutions related to the significant events they may encounter over their lifetime.

---

## Our Partnership with You

We aim to provide comprehensive wealth management within the context of a long-term partnership with you. Through our experience, we have learned it is important that everyone is clear on what to expect to develop and maintain a productive working relationship – one where we can help you work towards your wealth and lifestyle goals.

### Keys to a Productive Relationship: What You Can Expect

You can expect that we will consistently and responsibly perform services related to the provision, review, and ongoing monitoring of the wealth management solutions we implement on your behalf. We will always:
*   Strive to acquire and maintain a thorough understanding of your financial goals
*   Review your current financial information on a regular basis
*   Carefully assess and monitor your investment risk and time frame
*   Explain the implications of recommended strategies and answer your questions
*   Provide updates as appropriate by email, mail, and phone
*   Meet with you regularly to review what matters most to you
*   Serve as your primary Financial Advisor, coordinating the efforts of others when required
*   Treat you with utmost respect and professionalism

### Keys to a Productive Relationship: What We Can Expect

We’ve learned through experience that effective communication and mutual respect are essential to a long-term partnership. A few other criteria that help define our shared success include:
*   Your commitment to us as your Financial Advisory Team
*   Your trust in our abilities to provide you with recommendations and advice
*   Your complete disclosure about what matters to you most

We want you to know that our recommendations are always based on helping you pursue your financial and lifestyle goals. It is important you understand that all advice will be based on the information you provide to us. Therefore, to provide advice best suited to you, we need you to fully participate in The Wealth Empowerment Process with us.

Office Manager

Compliance Coordinator

**More About [REDACTED:NAME]**
[REDACTED:NAME] is married to her husband of [REDACTED:DATE] years, [REDACTED:NAME], and they have two children. They make their home in [REDACTED:ADDRESS] where they are very active in their community, church, local business organizations, and schools. In her spare time, [REDACTED:NAME] enjoys cross-fit, gardening, cooking, and driving the children to and from sporting events. She has a Paralegal degree from Perimeter College and also attended Valdosta State University.

---

## Our Partnership with Others

Because your financial situation can be complex, we often work collaboratively with other professionals to design and implement strategies intended to help you achieve your goals. We may rely on a network of professionals who provide technical advice as required.

The professionals we may work with include, but are not limited to:
*   Estate Lawyer
*   Certified Public Accountant
*   Mortgage Broker
*   Real Estate (Commercial and residential)
*   General Insurance

We believe it is beneficial for all of your professionals to communicate and work together to help ensure your goals are being addressed in the most effective ways possible.

---

## Our Beliefs

We believe today, more than ever, individuals and families are seeking professional advice from an advisor who:
*   Works in partnership with them over the long-term to help them pursue what matters to them;
*   Is passionately committed to helping them simplify, organize, and coordinate all aspects of their wealth management;
*   Has a well-defined process to guide them through essential aspects of wealth management; and
*   Is dedicated to providing professional, caring, and personalized solutions related to the significant events they may encounter over their lifetime.

---

## Our Partnership with You

We aim to provide comprehensive wealth management within the context of a long-term partnership with you. Through our experience, we have learned it is important that everyone is clear on what to expect to develop and maintain a productive working relationship – one where we can help you work towards your wealth and lifestyle goals.

### Keys to a Productive Relationship: What You Can Expect

You can expect that we will consistently and responsibly perform services related to the provision, review, and ongoing monitoring of the wealth management solutions we implement on your behalf. We will always:
*   Strive to acquire and maintain a thorough understanding of your financial goals
*   Review your current financial information on a regular basis
*   Carefully assess and monitor your investment risk and time frame
*   Explain the implications of recommended strategies and answer your questions
*   Provide updates as appropriate by email, mail, and phone
*   Meet with you regularly to review what matters most to you
*   Serve as your primary Financial Advisor, coordinating the efforts of others when required
*   Treat you with utmost respect and professionalism

### Keys to a Productive Relationship: What We Can Expect

We’ve learned through experience that effective communication and mutual respect are essential to a long-term partnership. A few other criteria that help define our shared success include:
*   Your commitment to us as your Financial Advisory Team
*   Your trust in our abilities to provide you with recommendations and advice
*   Your complete disclosure about what matters to you most

We want you to know that our recommendations are always based on helping you pursue your financial and lifestyle goals. It is important you understand that all advice will be based on the information you provide to us. Therefore, to provide advice best suited to you, we need you to fully participate in The Wealth Empowerment Process with us.

**Privus Times**

Welcome back to Privus Times!

We’re thrilled to bring you the second edition of our newsletter, Privus Times! At [REDACTED:ORG], we are committed to providing dedicated service and support to our clients. This newsletter is one way of staying connected and sharing some of the behind-the-scenes moments, exciting milestones, and updates from our valued partners. We are pleased to offer you a look into the [REDACTED:ORG] world and keep you informed about our team and community!

For this second edition of Privus Times, we’re excited to share a special message from our valued partners at [REDACTED:ORG], along with important reminders and event highlights. We are incredibly grateful for the amazing individuals who make up the [REDACTED:ORG] community— your continued engagement and energy contribute to the strength of our community. Thank you for being an essential part of our journey. We hope you enjoy this issue and feel just as inspired as we are for what’s ahead!

The Privus Team

ISSUE #2

July [REDACTED:DATE]

[REDACTED:ORG]

In this newsletter you can expect:

*   Partner Updates
*   Company Updates
*   Important Dates
*   Event Highlights
*   Staff Highlights
*   Monthly Recap

---

**Valued Partner Spotlight - A message from [REDACTED:ORG]**

---

**Market Commentary & Economic Outlook**

*Please note: The following market commentary and economic outlook are based on information available as of [REDACTED:DATE] and represent our current views, which are subject to change without notice. This information is for informational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice or a recommendation to buy or sell any security. Investing involves risk, and past performance is not indicative of future results.*

The US stock market experienced a notable rebound in Q2 [REDACTED:DATE], with the S&P 500 gaining 10.94%, reportedly as concerns regarding prolonged punitive US tariffs diminished. Year-to-date as of [REDACTED:DATE], the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite were up 6.2% and 5.85% respectively. *Past performance is not indicative of future results.* Concurrently, consensus S&P 500 corporate earnings estimates for FY[REDACTED:DATE] were revised down from $270 to $264/share, even amidst rising share prices.

Over the second quarter, the US 10-year government bond yield was mostly unchanged, ending at 4.23%, with the US 30-year fixed mortgage rate at 6.8%. The US Federal Reserve maintained the Fed Funds rate unchanged at 4.5%, holding steady against reported pressure from [REDACTED:ORG] to cut rates. Fed Chairman Powell has expressed concern about inflation expectations and inflation, which have remained persistently high, with the CPI and PCE running at 2.4% and 2.7% year-over-year, respectively, compared to the 2% Fed target. Employment remains strong in the US, with the unemployment rate at 4.1%. Currently, five-year “A” rated US investment grade corporate bonds yield 4.8%, while high yield “BB” bonds yield 5.8%. Based on observed market activity, credit markets generally appear optimistic, with perceived risk of rising default rates remaining low.

Regarding economic fundamentals, the US economy experienced a slowdown in Q2, which analysts have attributed to the impact of tariffs and trade policy uncertainty leading to lower business investment and capital expenditures. Q3 and Q4 GDP growth forecasts for [REDACTED:DATE] were subsequently revised down to 1.3% and 1.0%, respectively, compared to 2.7% and 2.5% in Q3 and Q4 [REDACTED:DATE]. Net exports reportedly turned sharply lower in June [REDACTED:DATE], which has been attributed to similar factors. Relief *could potentially arise* as bilateral trade deals are pursued and uncertainty dissipates with individual trading partners, particularly China, Europe, Canada, and Japan. It is our *current view* that significant trade deals *may be concluded* no later than end of 4Q[REDACTED:DATE], potentially in anticipation of the [REDACTED:DATE] US mid-term election campaign cycle.

The “Big Beautiful Bill” has been passed into US law. The corporate tax rate remains at 21%, but the effective rate for the median corporation *could potentially* drop to 14-15% with provisions for accelerated depreciation. This legislative clarity provides our investment committee with a distinct roadmap to navigate the coming quarters, allowing us to position client portfolios ahead of the broader market’s realization of these benefits. It *might also contribute to increased* business investment and capital expenditures, potentially easing backlogs, as trade uncertainty subsides. An increase in the US fiscal deficit *could potentially* keep inflation and interest rates higher for longer. This *might also contribute to* a structurally weaker US dollar, which *some analysts suggest could strengthen the discussion around* real assets, gold, and Bitcoin.

Overall, we maintain an optimistic outlook on stock and bond markets, *primarily due to our expectation that* business-friendly regulation and tax policy *could potentially* help offset the drag on corporate earnings from higher import tariffs. It is our belief that downward revisions to forecast corporate earnings for [REDACTED:DATE] *may have reached a floor*, and [REDACTED:DATE] forecasts *currently appear* optimistic. We anticipate that pressure from trade policy and tariffs *could potentially* lessen by the end of [REDACTED:DATE], leading into the [REDACTED:DATE] US mid-term election cycle. Key risks we observe include the potential for a lack of US fiscal budget discipline, which *could contribute to* elevated inflation and interest rates, and a weaker US dollar moving forward.

*Forward-looking statements, including those regarding economic forecasts, market trends, and policy impacts, are based on current expectations and assumptions about future events. They are inherently subject to risks, uncertainties, and changes in circumstances that are difficult to predict. Actual events or results may differ materially. There is no guarantee that any forecasts or opinions will be realized.*

---

**Event News!**

We had an incredible time at our annual Friday Night at the Races, and we want to extend a heartfelt thank you to everyone who joined us! The evening was filled with exciting horse races, great food and drinks, and, most importantly, meaningful connections among attendees. It was a wonderful opportunity to unwind, network, and celebrate the [REDACTED:ORG] community. We’re already looking forward to next year’s event—and we hope to see some new faces who weren’t able to attend this time around!

**Upcoming Event!** We’re excited to announce an exclusive Tax and Investment Event taking place on September [REDACTED:DATE], [REDACTED:DATE] at [REDACTED:ORG] in Irving! This event will offer valuable insights into tax strategies and investment planning, featuring expert perspectives in a relaxed and engaging setting. It’s a great opportunity to learn, connect, and enjoy a night out with the [REDACTED:ORG] community. If you’re interested in attending, please email [REDACTED:EMAIL] to reserve your spot—we’d love to have you there!

---

Thank you for reading!

[REDACTED:ORG]

[REDACTED:PHONE]

[REDACTED:URL]

[REDACTED:ADDRESS]

Rule ID: Rule 1.3 - General Prohibitions.
Reasoning: The text violates the general prohibitions because it uses a nickname ("Big Beautiful Bill") for a piece of legislation. Rule 1.3 prohibits information likely to cause an untrue implication; using a colloquial nickname implies the firm is unprofessional or politically biased, which is a material fact about the adviser's neutrality.

Here's the rewritten marketing copy, focused on SEC RIA compliance while preserving intent and factual content:

---

**Agenda**

*   Introduction
*   Assessment
*   FFG Approach
*   Who is FFG?

**Assessment**

Common client situations we help address include:

1.  Disparate assets with a lack of coordination and oversight.
2.  Significant liquidity commitments and constraints.
3.  Over-concentration in real estate and development projects.
4.  Navigating potentially opposing mandates between lifestyle and legacy building aspirations.
5.  Not being adequately capitalized for future needs.

**Our Approach**

Our solutions are designed to address complex financial situations and may include:

*   ERP Implementation support
*   Consolidating entities and financial reporting
*   Guidance on executive hiring, such as CEO/CFO roles
*   Recommendations for property management and project management services
*   Consolidating investment management efforts
*   Strategies to optimize liquidity requirements

**Who is FFG?**

We are a boutique family office dedicated to building long-term client relationships. We utilize a holistic and comprehensive approach to manage multi-generational wealth for high-net-worth families.

**Services**

*   Estate Planning
*   Accounting and Taxes
*   Insurance
*   Real Estate
*   Financing and Mortgages
*   Investment Management

**Objectives**

*   Build and maintain strong client relationships.
*   Provide dedicated availability and responsiveness for our clients.
*   Actively manage investment portfolios aligned with client goals.
*   Cultivate relationships with like-minded individuals and families.

**Fiduciary**

A fiduciary is an individual or entity with a legal or ethical responsibility to act in the best interests of their client or beneficiary, prioritizing their needs above their own.

Registered Investment Adviser (RIA) firms are registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) or state securities regulators, are subject to the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, and are held to a fiduciary duty to act in the best interest of their clients.

FFG operates under a fiduciary standard, committing to always act in the best interests of our clients.

*   [REDACTED:NAME] holds the Accredited Investment Fiduciary® (AIF®) designation, which demonstrates a commitment to acting in clients' best interests and adhering to fiduciary standards.
*   As a CFA charterholder, [REDACTED:NAME] is bound by the CFA Institute's Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct, requiring them to place clients' interests first, a key characteristic of a fiduciary relationship.

**Investment Management**

Our philosophy emphasizes a high-quality, client-focused approach.

*   We employ tactical and active management strategies, focusing on effective capital management.
*   We develop concentrated and conviction-based portfolios.
*   We typically do not utilize third-party managers or funds, focusing on direct investment management.
*   Investment decisions are made collaboratively by our investment committee.
*   We integrate robust risk management and hedging strategies throughout our portfolios.
*   Our approach emphasizes delivering value through active management and a focused capital management philosophy.

**Portfolio Strategies and Decision Making**

*   **Equities:** We focus on concentrated, conviction-based equity positions. Portfolios typically include a select number of individual holdings.
*   **Structured Notes:** Diversified across issuers, exposures, and maturities. Utilized strategically to pursue specific investment objectives and manage risk. Strategies have included the use of bearish notes to manage market exposure and complement equity allocations.
*   **Fixed Income:** We began purchasing individual fixed income securities following significant interest rate adjustments. We typically avoid bond funds in favor of direct bond ownership.
*   **Hedging on Positions:** We utilize options strategies to help protect embedded gains in specific positions while seeking to maintain upside potential.
*   **Covered Calls:** We manage actively covered call portfolios.
*   **Alternatives:** We may incorporate liquid alternatives, such as precious metals, and explore options for private equity, hedge funds, and real estate investment trusts (REITs) when aligned with client objectives.

**[REDACTED:ORG] Custody Solutions**

We leverage [REDACTED:ORG]'s institutional platform for client assets, which offers:

*   Access to global investment banking capabilities and direct trading desk access.
*   Ability to customize structured notes for institutional-level strategies.
*   Access to a comprehensive range of alternative fund options.
*   Opportunities to invest alongside [REDACTED:ORG] funds, when available and appropriate.
*   Access to institutional investment strategies, research, and analysis.
*   Resources for hedging, monetization, and lending solutions, including prepaid variable forwards for concentrated positions, securities-based lines of credit, and systematic trading solutions.

**Trust and Integrity**

*   We maintain a simple and transparent fee schedule.
*   Our commitment to clients extends to providing advice that may involve reducing assets under management if it aligns with their best interests.
*   Examples of our client-centric advice and approach may include guiding gold purchases, evaluating lending for tax purposes, ensuring ample portfolio liquidity, declining fees on excess cash when appropriate, and carefully considering alternative investments based on overall portfolio illiquidity.
*   We provide impartial advice and analysis of outside assets.
*   We operate without sales tactics and primarily accept new clients through referrals, reflecting our focus on building trusted relationships.
*   We are deeply involved in aspects of our client’s financial lives beyond just investment management.
*   We are committed to providing consistent support during significant transitions, ensuring clients receive ongoing benefits and resources.

**Our Relationship**

*   We aim to serve as a comprehensive family office, providing resources to help build and preserve wealth and legacy for our clients.
*   We are dedicated to building deep relationships with our clients and understanding their unique family dynamics over the long term.
*   Our approach prioritizes clients' personal and business interests.
*   We actively connect with and coordinate outside experts, such as estate planners and insurance specialists, to support comprehensive legacy planning.
*   We value all client relationships and are committed to maintaining them with integrity and dedication.

---
**General Disclosure:**
All investments involve risk, including the potential for loss of principal. Past performance is not indicative of future results. FFG does not guarantee any specific investment outcomes or returns. Investment strategies may not be suitable for all investors.

**Post Title: What Investors Can Be Grateful For This Holiday Season**

[REDACTED:NAME], [REDACTED:EMAIL] | Founder, Private Wealth Advisor

As the holidays approach, it can be a good time for reflection on our financial situations and investments. Reviewing the past year's market landscape can provide valuable context as we look ahead.

For context, recent market data indicates that the S&P 500 stock index has seen an increase of more than 15% including dividends over the past year. Bonds have also shown positive returns, gaining approximately 7%. Additionally, international stocks have outperformed U.S. stocks this year, a shift from recent trends. Investors holding a diversified portfolio, which includes various types of investments, may have observed positive effects from these market movements. Here's what to keep in mind as we head into next year.

### Market Cycles and Historical Trends

Historically, market cycles are dynamic. This past year has seen a continuation of a general upward trend, often referred to as a "bull market," which began in October 2022. While markets have experienced fluctuations, this period has been marked by overall gains.

Historical market patterns suggest that periods of sustained growth, commonly termed 'bull markets,' have often spanned longer durations compared to 'bear markets' characterized by declining prices. While future market movements are inherently unpredictable, maintaining a long-term investment perspective has historically been associated with positive outcomes for many investors. This year’s bond performance, in particular, has been noteworthy, especially following periods when rising interest rates impacted bond valuations. Recent adjustments by the Federal Reserve (the Fed) to interest rates have coincided with an increase in bond prices. This illustrates the potential role of both stocks and bonds within a diversified portfolio.

A key takeaway from market history is the challenge of accurately predicting short-term fluctuations. For example, a temporary market downturn in April, reportedly influenced by tariff news, was followed by a subsequent recovery where markets reached new highs. This period served as a reminder of the value of our proprietary oversight; while market timing penalizes the average investor, our strategic discipline helped ensure clients held their positions through the downturn, positioning them to capture the subsequent market rebound.

### Inflation and Interest Rate Trends

Recent data indicates that inflation, while still a factor, has shown signs of moderation, with prices increasing approximately 3% from the prior year. This represents a more stable environment compared to earlier periods, leading to a general reduction in concerns about rapidly accelerating inflation.

In response to these economic shifts, the Federal Reserve has begun to adjust interest rates. Historically, lower interest rates can generally create more favorable conditions for both equity and fixed income markets, by potentially reducing borrowing costs for businesses and consumers, and by increasing the value of existing bonds. While inflation and interest rates remain important economic considerations, the intensity of some past concerns appears to have lessened.

### The Role of Diversification in Managing Risk

Establishing an appropriate allocation of investments suited to individual circumstances is a fundamental aspect of financial planning. As is typical, the upcoming year is expected to present its own set of economic uncertainties, which can lead to concerns about potential market downturns. Rather than reacting to daily market fluctuations, maintaining a portfolio designed to perform across various market conditions can be a beneficial strategy.

Following a period of market appreciation, a focus on risk management becomes particularly relevant. Current market valuations, such as stock prices relative to company earnings, may be considered elevated compared to historical averages. While this does not preclude further market growth, it can suggest that the pace of future returns may moderate. This highlights the importance of considering a broad range of investment types, rather than concentrating solely on those that have recently been most popular.

Economic and geopolitical developments, including discussions around artificial intelligence, trade policies, and political landscapes, will undoubtedly continue to be subjects of discussion. Historical observations suggest that reacting impulsively to such events may potentially hinder long-term financial progress. A consistent focus on one's long-term financial objectives generally remains a prudent approach. As a financial advisor, I am available to discuss your specific goals and explore potential strategies to help you pursue them.

In summary, the holiday season can offer a valuable opportunity for reflection and financial review. A thoughtfully constructed portfolio, characterized by diversification across various asset classes, may potentially contribute to working towards your financial objectives.

**Firm and Composite Information**
[REDACTED:ORG] is an independent investment management firm that manages equity and fixed income portfolios. The firm is defined as all accounts managed by [REDACTED:ORG]’s Institutional, Retail, and Wholesale Divisions. [REDACTED:ORG] is an investment adviser registered under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940. Registration does not imply a certain level of skill or training. The firm manages a variety of equity portfolios, and also manages fixed income portfolios.

As of 9/30/2017, [REDACTED:ORG] was redefined to include all Institutional, Retail, and Wholesale accounts managed by the firm. Prior to this date and for the purposes of complying with the GIPS Standards, the firm’s Institutional division was defined separately from the firm’s Retail and Wholesale Division. Performance for the Focus Growth composite prior to 9/30/2017 consists of performance achieved at [REDACTED:ORG]’s Retail and Wholesale Division.

The Zacks Focus Growth Strategy (Inception Date: February 2003) invests in a diversified group of stocks that [REDACTED:ORG] believes will outperform the market over the next twelve months. The strategy primarily invests in growth-oriented stocks with a large-cap bias. The Focus Growth Strategy makes use of a proprietary multi-factor model. The Strategy typically contains 40 to 100 stocks and is diversified across multiple sectors. The strategy makes use of an optimizer. The strategy benchmark is the Russell 1000 Growth Index. The minimum account size for inclusion in the composite is $100,000. The Focus Growth Composite was created in February 2003. A complete list of composite descriptions is available upon request.

**Benchmark**
The Russell 1000 Growth Index is a well-known, unmanaged index of the prices of 1000 large-company growth common stocks selected by Russell. **The Russell 1000 Growth Index assumes reinvestment of dividends but does not reflect advisory fees, transaction costs, or other expenses. An investor cannot invest directly in an index.** The volatility of the benchmark may be materially different from the individual performance obtained by a specific investor. Benchmark returns are not covered by the report of independent verifiers.

**Performance Calculations**
Valuations and returns are computed and stated in U.S. Dollars. Results reflect the reinvestment of dividends and other earnings.
*   **\*Pure Gross of Fees Returns:** These returns are presented as supplemental information, are gross of transaction costs, management fees, custodian fees, and withholding taxes.
*   **\*\*Net of Fees Returns:** These returns are calculated using the highest management fee paid and are presented net of a bundled fee which includes transaction costs, management fees, custodian fees, and withholding fees. The standard management fee for the Focus Growth strategy is 1.75% per annum. Additional information regarding fees is included in Part 2A of Form ADV.

If a cash flow amount exceeds 20% of the portfolio, that account’s performance will not be included for that month. Accounts are added back into the composite the following month. Internal dispersion is calculated using the asset-weighted standard deviation of all accounts included in the composite for the entire year. Gross-of-fee returns are used for the calculation. The three-year annualized standard deviation measures the variability of the composite and the benchmark gross returns over the preceding 36-month period. Policies for valuing portfolios, calculating performance, and preparing GIPS Reports are available upon request.

GIPS® is a registered trademark of CFA Institute. CFA Institute does not endorse or promote this organization, nor does it warrant the accuracy or quality of the content contained herein.

**Past performance is not indicative of future results. Investing involves risk, including the possible loss of principal.**

**Glossary**
*   **\*This information is supplemental to GIPS and is based off the composite.**
*   **\*\*\*The standard deviation shown here is calculated since inception.**
*   **Alpha:** A measure of the portfolio’s risk-adjusted performance. When compared to the portfolio’s beta, a positive alpha indicates better-than-expected portfolio performance and a negative alpha worse-than-expected portfolio performance.
*   **Beta:** A measure of the volatility of a portfolio relative to the overall market. A beta less than 1.0 indicates lower risk than the market; a beta greater than 1.0 indicates higher risk than the market. It is most reliable as a risk measure when the return fluctuations of the portfolio are highly correlated with the return fluctuations of the index chosen to represent the market.
*   **Sharpe Ratio:** The greater the Sharpe ratio, the better risk-adjusted performance has been. It is calculated by subtracting the risk-free rate of return (e.g., 10-year U.S. Treasury bond) from the portfolio’s return and dividing this value by the portfolio’s standard deviation.
*   **Standard Deviation:** An indicator of the portfolio’s total return volatility, which is based on a minimum of 36 monthly returns. The larger the portfolio’s standard deviation, the greater the portfolio’s volatility.
*   **Market Capitalization:** The value of a corporation as determined by the market price of its issued and outstanding common stock. It is calculated by multiplying the number of outstanding shares by the current market price of a share.
*   **Price/Book ratio (P/B):** The ratio of a stock’s price to its book value per share.
*   **Price/Earnings ratio (P/E):** The price of a stock divided by its earnings per share.

The Privus Team

ISSUE #2

July [REDACTED:DATE]

[REDACTED:ORG]

In this newsletter you can expect:

*   Partner Updates

**Valued Partner Spotlight - A message from [REDACTED:ORG]**

---

**Market Commentary & Economic Outlook**

*Please note: The following market commentary and economic outlook are based on information available as of [REDACTED:DATE] and represent our current views, which are subject to change without notice. This information is for informational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice or a recommendation to buy or sell any security. Investing involves risk, and past performance is not indicative of future results.*

The US stock market experienced a notable rebound in Q2 [REDACTED:DATE], with the S&P 500 gaining 10.94%, reportedly as concerns regarding prolonged punitive US tariffs diminished. Year-to-date as of [REDACTED:DATE], the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite were up 6.2% and 5.85% respectively. *Past performance is not indicative of future results.* Concurrently, consensus S&P 500 corporate earnings estimates for FY[REDACTED:DATE] were revised down from $270 to $264/share, even amidst rising share prices.

Over the second quarter, the US 10-year government bond yield was mostly unchanged, ending at 4.23%, with the US 30-year fixed mortgage rate at 6.8%. The US Federal Reserve maintained the Fed Funds rate unchanged at 4.5%, holding steady against reported pressure from [REDACTED:ORG] to cut rates. Fed Chairman Powell has expressed concern about inflation expectations and inflation, which have remained persistently high, with the CPI and PCE running at 2.4% and 2.7% year-over-year, respectively, compared to the 2% Fed target. Employment remains strong in the US, with the unemployment rate at 4.1%. Currently, five-year “A” rated US investment grade corporate bonds yield 4.8%, while high yield “BB” bonds yield 5.8%. Based on observed market activity, credit markets generally appear optimistic, with perceived risk of rising default rates remaining low.

Regarding economic fundamentals, the US economy experienced a slowdown in Q2, which analysts have attributed to the impact of tariffs and trade policy uncertainty leading to lower business investment and capital expenditures. Q3 and Q4 GDP growth forecasts for [REDACTED:DATE] were subsequently revised down to 1.3% and 1.0%, respectively, compared to 2.7% and 2.5% in Q3 and Q4 [REDACTED:DATE]. Net exports reportedly turned sharply lower in June [REDACTED:DATE], which has been attributed to similar factors. Relief *could potentially arise* as bilateral trade deals are pursued and uncertainty dissipates with individual trading partners, particularly China, Europe, Canada, and Japan. It is our *current view* that significant trade deals *may be concluded* no later than end of 4Q[REDACTED:DATE], potentially in anticipation of the [REDACTED:DATE] US mid-term election campaign cycle.

The “Big Beautiful Bill” has been passed into US law. The corporate tax rate remains at 21%, but the effective rate for the median corporation *could potentially* drop to 14-15% with provisions for accelerated depreciation. We interpret this as a definitive signal for business investment, and consequently, we are currently overweighting industrial sectors in our model portfolios to capitalize on the favorable depreciation schedule. An increase in the US fiscal deficit *could potentially* keep inflation and interest rates higher for longer. This *might also contribute to* a structurally weaker US dollar, which *some analysts suggest could strengthen the discussion around* real assets, gold, and Bitcoin.

Overall, we maintain an optimistic outlook on stock and bond markets, *primarily due to our expectation that* business-friendly regulation and tax policy *could potentially* help offset the drag on corporate earnings from higher import tariffs. It is our belief that downward revisions to forecast corporate earnings for [REDACTED:DATE] *may have reached a floor*, and [REDACTED:DATE] forecasts *currently appear* optimistic. We anticipate that pressure from trade policy and tariffs *could potentially* lessen by the end of [REDACTED:DATE], leading into the [REDACTED:DATE] US mid-term election cycle. Key risks we observe include the potential for a lack of US fiscal budget discipline, which *could contribute to* elevated inflation and interest rates, and a weaker US dollar moving forward.

*Forward-looking statements, including those regarding economic forecasts, market trends, and policy impacts, are based on current expectations and assumptions about future events. They are inherently subject to risks, uncertainties, and changes in circumstances that are difficult to predict. Actual events or results may differ materially. There is no guarantee that any forecasts or opinions will be realized.*

---

We had an incredible time at our annual Friday Night at the Races, and we want to extend a heartfelt thank you to everyone who joined us! The evening was filled with exciting horse races, great food and drinks, and, most importantly, meaningful connections among attendees. It was a wonderful opportunity to unwind, network, and celebrate the [REDACTED:ORG] community. We’re already looking forward to next year’s event—and we hope to see some new faces who weren’t able to attend this time around!

**Upcoming Event!** We’re excited to announce an exclusive Tax and Investment Event taking place on September [REDACTED:DATE], [REDACTED:DATE] at [REDACTED:ORG] in Irving! This event will offer valuable insights into tax strategies and investment planning, featuring expert perspectives in a relaxed and engaging setting. It’s a great opportunity to learn, connect, and enjoy a night out with the [REDACTED:ORG] community. If you’re interested in attending, please email [REDACTED:EMAIL] to reserve your spot—we’d love to have you there!

---

Thank you for reading!

[REDACTED:ORG]

[REDACTED:PHONE]

base_text:
Here's a revised version of your marketing copy, adjusted for SEC RIA compliance while preserving the original intent, voice, and factual content:

---

**[REDACTED:ORG]**
[REDACTED:PHONE] | [REDACTED:URL]
[REDACTED:ADDRESS]

**Important Reminders!**

Friendly reminder – corporate taxes are due September 15th, [REDACTED:DATE]. To assist you effectively with your financial planning that incorporates tax considerations, please be sure to send us all relevant tax-related information as soon as possible so we can begin our process. Our internal deadline to receive this information is September 1st, [REDACTED:DATE]. This allows us ample time to review everything and coordinate any necessary adjustments. Thank you for helping us keep everything running smoothly!

---

**Upcoming Client Event: Tax & Investment Insights**

We're excited to remind you about our upcoming client event, "Tax & Investment Insights," happening on September 19th, [REDACTED:DATE]! This special event offers a valuable opportunity to learn about various tax strategies that may be relevant to your financial planning.

We still have some availability, so if you would like to attend, please let us know as soon as possible to secure your place. We look forward to seeing you there!

*Please note: [REDACTED:ORG] provides financial advisory services and does not offer tax preparation or specific tax advice. The information presented at this event is for educational purposes only, and we strongly recommend consulting with a qualified tax professional for personalized guidance regarding your individual tax situation.*

---

Thank you for reading!

---

**Key Changes and Compliance Rationale:**

1.  **Tax Deadline Reminder:**
    *   Changed "so we can get started" to "so we can begin our process" and added "with your financial planning that incorporates tax considerations" to clarify the RIA's role in tax coordination/planning rather than direct tax preparation, unless that is a clearly separate service they also offer.
2.  **Event Promotion:**
    *   "Exclusive Tax & Investment Event" changed to "**Upcoming Client Event: Tax & Investment Insights**" and "special event" to avoid any implication of superior knowledge or benefit not genuinely available to all clients.
    *   "Fantastic opportunity to learn valuable tax strategies you can begin implementing" was clarified to "valuable opportunity to learn about various tax strategies that may be relevant to your financial planning." This maintains the educational intent without implying that attendees can immediately implement complex strategies without professional guidance.
    *   **Added a prominent disclosure:** "Please note: [REDACTED:ORG] provides financial advisory services and does not offer tax preparation or specific tax advice. The information presented at this event is for educational purposes only, and we strongly recommend consulting with a qualified tax professional for personalized guidance regarding your individual tax situation." This is crucial for RIAs when discussing tax-related topics to clearly define their scope of service and manage client expectations regarding advice.

**IMPORTANT DISCLOSURES REGARDING HYPOTHETICAL MODEL PERFORMANCE**

**This report presents hypothetical model portfolio performance for illustrative purposes only. It does not represent actual client performance, nor does it reflect the performance of any actual accounts. As hypothetical performance results do not represent actual trading, they may not reflect the impact of material economic and market factors that might have affected FFG's decision-making if it were managing actual client money. There is no guarantee that these results will be achieved, and actual client performance may vary significantly.**

**Hypothetical performance has inherent limitations:**
*   **It does not involve actual financial risk, and no actual investment decisions were made. Therefore, the results do not reflect the impact of financial risk or the ability to withstand losses.**
*   **It is often created with the benefit of hindsight, which can allow for the selection of investments or strategies that have performed well in the past.**
*   **The model does not account for the impact of liquidity constraints, market depth, or certain transaction costs (beyond advisory fees) that actual portfolios would incur.**
*   **The model may not account for the full impact of taxes or other expenses that would affect actual client portfolios.**

**Assumptions Used in This Illustrative Model:**
*   **The model assumes specific market conditions, asset class returns, and volatility levels for the entire illustration period (April 1, 2017 - November 7, 2025), including future periods, which may not materialize.**
*   **Performance returns are presented after advisory fees are deducted, which are assumed to be consistent with FFG's standard fee schedule. Other fees such as custodial fees, transaction charges, and taxes are generally not deducted and would reduce actual returns.**
*   **The model assumes the reinvestment of dividends and other earnings.**
*   **The model may assume a specific rebalancing frequency and methodology.**
*   **The specific securities listed are for illustrative purposes only to demonstrate potential asset types within a hypothetical model portfolio and do not represent a recommendation to buy or sell any particular security. The actual selection of securities and their performance within an actual client account would depend on various factors including the client's individual objectives and risk tolerance.**
*   **Benchmarks used (S&P 500, Barclays Aggregate Bond Index, 90-Day T-Bill, Alternative Blend, 6% Absolute Return) are unmanaged indices and do not reflect the deduction of advisory fees, transaction costs, or other expenses. Investors cannot invest directly in an index. The "Alternative Blend" and "6% Absolute Return" benchmarks are internally constructed for comparative purposes and may not represent actual market benchmarks.**

**General Disclosures:**
*   This report should not be used as a substitute for your monthly statement, 1099, or to determine taxability.
*   The inception date indicates the date the hypothetical model began its simulation. This date does not correspond to the opening date of any actual client account.
*   This analysis is for informational purposes only and is intended to be used as part of a complete portfolio review with your financial advisor.
*   All investment strategies have the potential for profit or loss. Changes in investment strategies, contributions or withdrawals, and economic conditions may materially change how well any portfolio performs.
*   All information in this report is based on sources that are believed to be reliable, but no warranty is made as to its accuracy or completeness. Please contact us immediately if there is a discrepancy between this report and your brokerage statement, or if your financial circumstances change.

**This report presents hypothetical model portfolio performance for illustrative purposes only. There is no guarantee that these results will be achieved, and actual client performance may vary significantly.**

**Hypothetical performance has inherent limitations:**
*   **It does not involve actual financial risk, and no actual investment decisions were made. Therefore, the results do not reflect the impact of financial risk or the ability to withstand losses.**
*   **It is often created with the benefit of hindsight, which can allow for the selection of investments or strategies that have performed well in the past.**
*   **The model does not account for the impact of liquidity constraints, market depth, or certain transaction costs (beyond advisory fees) that actual portfolios would incur.**

*   **Performance returns are presented after advisory fees are deducted, which are assumed to be consistent with FFG's standard fee schedule. Other fees such as custodial fees, transaction charges, and taxes are generally not deducted and would reduce actual returns.**
*   **The model assumes the reinvestment of dividends and other earnings.**
*   **The model may assume a specific rebalancing frequency and methodology.**
*   **The specific securities listed are for illustrative purposes only to demonstrate potential asset types within a hypothetical model portfolio and do not represent a recommendation to buy or sell any particular security. The actual selection of securities and their performance within an actual client account would depend on various factors including the client's individual objectives and risk tolerance.**
*   **Benchmarks used (S&P 500, Barclays Aggregate Bond Index, 90-Day T-Bill, Alternative Blend, 6% Absolute Return) are unmanaged indices and do not reflect the deduction of advisory fees, transaction costs, or other expenses. Investors cannot invest directly in an index. The "Alternative Blend" and "6% Absolute Return" benchmarks are internally constructed for comparative purposes and may not represent actual market benchmarks.**

**General Disclosures:**
*   This report should not be used as a substitute for your monthly statement, 1099, or to determine taxability.
*   The inception date indicates the date the hypothetical model began its simulation. This date does not correspond to the opening date of any actual client account.
*   This analysis is for informational purposes only and is intended to be used as part of a complete portfolio review with your financial advisor.
*   All investment strategies have the potential for profit or loss. Changes in investment strategies, contributions or withdrawals, and economic conditions may materially change how well any portfolio performs.
*   All information in this report is based on sources that are believed to be reliable, but no warranty is made as to its accuracy or completeness. Please contact us immediately if there is a discrepancy between this report and your brokerage statement, or if your financial circumstances change.
original_rejected:
<think>
The violation occurs on Page 4 in the holdings table. The inclusion of "ISHARES BITCOIN TRUST ETF" and "ISHARES ETHEREUM TRUST ETF" violates **Rule 1.5 - General Prohibitions**. Specifically, this rule prohibits the inclusion of speculative digital assets in illustrative model portfolios distributed to retail clients because the volatility of these assets (Bitcoin and Ethereum) makes the "Fair and Balanced" requirement impossible to meet. Showing crypto assets alongside traditional assets like Treasuries creates a misleading impression of safety.
</think>
<critique>
The inclusion of cryptocurrency ETFs in the holdings table violates Rule 1.5 because digital assets are considered inherently too volatile for hypothetical illustrations. To fix this, these rows must be removed from the table entirely.
</critique>

---

**Privus Times | August 2025 | Issue #3**

Welcome back to Privus Times!

**PRIVUS FINANCIAL**

We’re thrilled to bring you the third edition of our newsletter, Privus Times!

At [REDACTED:ORG], we strive to be a dedicated, client-focused financial practice committed to supporting the financial goals of those we serve. This newsletter is one way we aim to stay connected and share insights, firm updates, and perspectives from our network.

For this edition, we’re pleased to share a message from our partner, [REDACTED:ORG] Insurance, and their CEO, [REDACTED:NAME].

We are grateful to collaborate with various individuals and businesses who provide valuable insights and contribute to the broader financial community.

We look forward to offering you a glimpse into the [REDACTED:ORG] world and keeping you informed about our team and community!

We hope you enjoy this third edition of Privus Times and look forward to the opportunities ahead!

The [REDACTED:ORG] Team

---

**A Message from Our CEO, [REDACTED:NAME]**

“Many people ask me what the most common question I get about finances is. Interestingly, it often ties directly to the topic we’re featuring in today’s newsletter. The top two questions I frequently hear are: ‘How do I find and retain employees?’ and ‘How do I increase my EBITDA so I can sell my business?’ Our partner, [REDACTED:ORG] Insurance, believes their ‘Champ Plan’ offers potential approaches to address these challenges. I encourage you to learn more directly from [REDACTED:NAME] and explore their perspective on how it might make a difference for businesses facing these questions.”

---

**IMPORTANT DISCLOSURE:**
[REDACTED:ORG] has a business relationship with [REDACTED:ORG] Insurance. [**Please insert specific details here, e.g., "We may receive compensation for client referrals to [REDACTED:ORG] Insurance," or "While we do not receive compensation for this feature, we value their insights as a strategic partner." This disclosure must be clear and conspicuous.**]

**Investment Vehicles**

**Stocks**
• Purchasing stocks results in ownership in a company.
• Stocks provide the engine for long-term growth and wealth building.
• As a company grows, the value of their stock increases.

**ETFs & Mutual Funds**
• Represent managed "baskets" of individual stocks and/or bonds.
• These provide exposure to a wide variety of asset classes, diversifying portfolio strategy.

**Bonds**
• A loan made by an investor to a borrower (e.g., a company or government).
• Issuers agree to pay back a debt obligation with interest.
• Bonds provide regular income and create portfolio stability.

**Risk Mitigation**

**Diversification:** A strategy to help manage risk by spreading your money across a variety of assets. This approach aims to reduce the impact of individual stock volatility, industry instability, and emotional bias.

**Types of Diversification:**
o Geographic – Globally / Internationally
o Industry or Sector – Healthcare, Technology, Energy, etc.
o Asset Class – Bonds, Stocks, etc.
o Company Size – Large Cap, Mid Cap, Small Cap
o Investment Style – Growth vs. Value

**Asset Allocation:** Distributing a portfolio across different asset classes (stocks, bonds, cash, real estate, commodities, etc.), typically influenced by investment goals, risk tolerance, and time horizon.

**Behavioral Investing**

**Emotion-Based Investing**
o Overconfidence Bias: Believing you can time the market
o Fear: Selling during a market dip
o Panic: Reacting to headlines/news without context
o Impatience: Buying high, selling low

*Objective, process-based investment advising aims to help mitigate emotional investing.*
